sections.title: Introduction & Role Context
sections.goal: Establish the interviewee's role in Titan DR drills and clarify scope of responsibilities.
sample_questions: Can you briefly describe your role as an SRE in the Titan DR project?
Which parts of the DR drill process are you directly responsible for?
How do you coordinate with other departments during a drill?

sections.title: DR Runbook Familiarity
sections.goal: Assess depth of knowledge in RB-DR-001 Regional Failover Procedure and related artifacts.
sample_questions: Walk me through the key steps of RB-DR-001.
How do you ensure compliance with RTO/RPO targets during a failover?
What preconditions must be verified before initiating a failover?

sections.title: Incident Simulation & Coordination
sections.goal: Explore experience in simulated outages and cross-team dependencies.
sample_questions: Describe a recent GameDay exercise and your role in it.
How do you communicate status updates to stakeholders during a drill?
What tools and dashboards do you rely on during failover?

sections.title: Cross-Project Dependencies
sections.goal: Identify how Titan DR interacts with other systems like Helios Datalake or Orion Edge Gateway.
sample_questions: What are the main upstream/downstream systems affected by Titan DR failover?
How do you coordinate with data and networking teams during a DR event?
Can you share an example where a dependency impacted DR outcomes?

sections.title: Risk Management & Continuous Improvement
sections.goal: Understand approach to identifying risks, trade-offs, and improvement actions post-drill.
sample_questions: What are the top three risks in the current DR strategy?
How do you document and track improvement actions from GameDay findings?
Describe a trade-off you had to make between failover speed and blast radius.

sections.title: Wrap-Up & Reflection
sections.goal: Summarize learnings, personal contributions, and next steps.
sample_questions: What is your proudest achievement in the Titan DR project?
If you could change one thing about the current DR process, what would it be?
How do you prepare yourself and your team for the next drill?
